00038  * \file storage.h
00039  * \brief Public declarations for \ref SimpleDataObjects Module.

00043  * $Date: 2006/08/30 19:20:01 $

00046 #ifndef _FC_STORAGE_H_
00047 #define _FC_STORAGE_H_
00048 
00049 #ifdef __cplusplus
00050 extern "C" {
00051 #endif
00052 
00053 // Simple data objects: int arrays, linked lists & masks
00054 
00055 /** \name Typedefs */
00056 //-------------------------------
00057 //@{
00058 
00059 /**
00060  * \ingroup   SimpleDataObjects
00061  * \brief Coordinates data structure
00062  *
00063  * \description
00064  * 
00065  *    Structure to hold coordinates. Maximum dimensionality is 3. 
00066  *    (This is essentially a double[3] declaration).
00067  */
00068 typedef double FC_Coords[3];
00069 
00070 /**
00071  * \ingroup   SimpleDataObjects
00072  * \brief Vector data structure
00073  *
00074  * \description
00075  * 
00076  *    Structure to hold a vector, assuming that it originates
00077  *    at the origin. Maximum dimensionality is 3. (This is
00078  *    essentially a double[3] declaration).
00079  *
00080  */
00081 typedef double FC_Vector[3];
00082 
00083 /**
00084  * \ingroup  SimpleDataObjects
00085  * \brief Sorted, exclusive, self-exanding int array
00086  *
00087  * \description
00088  *
00089  *   Use this object and it's functions to maintain a sorted int array.
00090  *   The array is self expanding and maintains a sorted, unique, set
00091  *   of integers. The array does not automatically shrink, but \ref 
00092  *   fc_squeezeSortedIntArray() can be used to minimize memory usage.
00093  *
00094  * \modifications 
00095  *    - 06/06/06 ACG created
00096  */
00097 typedef struct {
00098   int numVal;     /**< number of values */
00099   int maxNumVal;  /**< total allocated space (max possible number of values) */
00100   int* vals;      /**< int array holding the values */
00101 } FC_SortedIntArray;
00102 
00103 /**
00104  * \ingroup  SimpleDataObjects
00105  * \brief Sorted, exclusive, self-exanding array of data blobs
00106  *
00107  * \description
00108  *
00109  *   Use this object and it's functions to maintain a sorted array of data
00110  *   "blobs". It's implemented as an array of void pointers and the user must
00111  *   provide the size of the blobs and a comparison function. The array is self
00112  *   expanding and maintains a sorted, unique, set of the blobs integers. The
00113  *   array does not automatically shrink, but \ref fc_squeezeSortedBlobArray()
00114  *   can be used to minimize memory usage.
00115  *
00116  * \todo ?Store the compare function and have it provided during init? What
00117  *     Happens on free?
00118  *
00119  * \modifications 
00120  *    - 06/07/06 WSD created
00121  */
00122 typedef struct {
00123   int numBlob;     /**< number of blobs */
00124   int maxNumBlob;  /**< total allocated space (max possible number of blobs) */
00125   void** blobs;    /**< array of blobs */
00126 } FC_SortedBlobArray;
00127 
00128 //@}
00129 
00130 //sorted int array routines
00131 FC_ReturnCode fc_initSortedIntArray(FC_SortedIntArray *sia);
00132 int fc_isSortedIntArrayValid(FC_SortedIntArray* sia);
00133 FC_ReturnCode fc_copySortedIntArray(FC_SortedIntArray *sia_src,
00134                        FC_SortedIntArray *sia_dest);
00135 FC_ReturnCode fc_getSortedIntArrayNumValue(FC_SortedIntArray *sia, 
00136                   int* numVal);
00137 FC_ReturnCode fc_getSortedIntArrayValues(FC_SortedIntArray *sia,
00138                int* numVal, int** values);
00139 int fc_isIntInSortedIntArray(FC_SortedIntArray *sia, int i);
00140 int fc_addIntToSortedIntArray(FC_SortedIntArray *sia, int i);
00141 int fc_addIntArrayToSortedIntArray(FC_SortedIntArray *sia, int num, 
00142                        int* array, int isSorted);
00143 int fc_deleteIntFromSortedIntArray(FC_SortedIntArray *sia, int i);
00144 FC_ReturnCode fc_getSortedIntArrayFront(FC_SortedIntArray *sia, int* value);
00145 FC_ReturnCode fc_getSortedIntArrayBack(FC_SortedIntArray *sia, int* value); 
00146 int fc_popSortedIntArrayFront(FC_SortedIntArray *sia);
00147 int fc_popSortedIntArrayBack(FC_SortedIntArray *sia);
00148 FC_ReturnCode fc_squeezeSortedIntArray(FC_SortedIntArray *sia);
00149 void fc_freeSortedIntArray(FC_SortedIntArray *sia);
00150 FC_ReturnCode fc_printSortedIntArray(FC_SortedIntArray *sia);
00151 
00152 // sorted blob array routines
00153 FC_ReturnCode fc_initSortedBlobArray(FC_SortedBlobArray *sba);
00154 int fc_isSortedBlobArrayValid(FC_SortedBlobArray* sba);
00155 FC_ReturnCode fc_getSortedBlobArrayNumBlob(FC_SortedBlobArray *sba, 
00156                   int* numBlob);
00157 FC_ReturnCode fc_getSortedBlobArrayBlobs(FC_SortedBlobArray *sba,
00158                int* numBlob, void*** blobs);
00159 int fc_isBlobInSortedBlobArray(FC_SortedBlobArray *sba, void* blob, 
00160              int blobCmp(const void* blob1, const void* blob2),
00161              void** found_blob);
00162 int fc_addBlobToSortedBlobArray(FC_SortedBlobArray *sba, void* blob,
00163              int blobCmp(const void* blob1, const void* blob2));
00164 int fc_deleteBlobFromSortedBlobArray(FC_SortedBlobArray *sba, void* blob,
00165                    int blobCmp(const void* blob1, const void* blob2),
00166              void** deleted_blob);
00167 FC_ReturnCode fc_squeezeSortedBlobArray(FC_SortedBlobArray *sba);
00168 void fc_freeSortedBlobArray(FC_SortedBlobArray *sba);

00174                         int isSorted, FC_SortedIntArray* sia);

00176                int* num, int** array);

00181 FC_ReturnCode fc_createMaskFromIntArray(int numArray, int* array, int numMask, 
00182                          int** mask);
